trans-unit.source: Machine Learning app: Sentiment analysis | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning app: Sentiment analysis | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Text Analytics API is a suite of text analytics built with Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: Text Analytics API is a suite of text analytics built with Azure Machine Learning.

trans-unit.source: The API can be used to analyze unstructured text for tasks such as sentiment analysis and key phrase extraction.
trans-unit.target: The API can be used to analyze unstructured text for tasks such as sentiment analysis and key phrase extraction.

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning app: Text Analytics Service for analyzing sentiment
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning app: Text Analytics Service for analyzing sentiment

trans-unit.source: Text Analytics API is a suite of text analytics [web services]( https://datamarket.azure.com/dataset/amla/text-analytics) built with Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: Text Analytics API is a suite of text analytics [web services]( https://datamarket.azure.com/dataset/amla/text-analytics) built with Azure Machine Learning.

trans-unit.source: The API can be used to analyze unstructured text for tasks such as sentiment analysis and key phrase extraction.
trans-unit.target: The API can be used to analyze unstructured text for tasks such as sentiment analysis and key phrase extraction.

trans-unit.source: No training data is needed to use this API, just bring your text data.
trans-unit.target: No training data is needed to use this API, just bring your text data.

trans-unit.source: We support English language only right now.
trans-unit.target: We support English language only right now.

trans-unit.source: This API uses advanced natural language processing techniques under the hood.
trans-unit.target: This API uses advanced natural language processing techniques under the hood.

trans-unit.source: The API returns a numeric score between 0 & 1.
trans-unit.target: The API returns a numeric score between 0 & 1.

trans-unit.source: Scores close to 1 indicate positive sentiment, while scores close to 0 indicate negative sentiment.
trans-unit.target: Scores close to 1 indicate positive sentiment, while scores close to 0 indicate negative sentiment.

trans-unit.source: Sentiment score is generated using classification techniques.
trans-unit.target: Sentiment score is generated using classification techniques.

trans-unit.source: The input features to the classifier include n-grams, features generated from part-of-speech tags, and word embeddings.
trans-unit.target: The input features to the classifier include n-grams, features generated from part-of-speech tags, and word embeddings.

trans-unit.source: The API returns a list of strings denoting the key talking points in the input text.
trans-unit.target: The API returns a list of strings denoting the key talking points in the input text.

trans-unit.source: We employ techniques from Microsoft Office's sophisticated Natural Language Processing toolkit.
trans-unit.target: We employ techniques from Microsoft Office's sophisticated Natural Language Processing toolkit.

trans-unit.source: In the GET call below, we are requesting for the sentiment for the phrase *Hello World*
trans-unit.target: In the GET call below, we are requesting for the sentiment for the phrase *Hello World*

trans-unit.source: In the GET call below, we are requesting for the sentiment for the key phrases in the text *It was a wonderful hotel to stay at, with unique decor and friendly staff*
trans-unit.target: In the GET call below, we are requesting for the sentiment for the key phrases in the text *It was a wonderful hotel to stay at, with unique decor and friendly staff*

trans-unit.source: In the POST call below, we are requesting for the sentiments of the following phrases: Hello World, Hello Foo World, Hello My World in the body of the request
trans-unit.target: In the POST call below, we are requesting for the sentiments of the following phrases: Hello World, Hello Foo World, Hello My World in the body of the request

trans-unit.source: In the response below, you get the list of scores associated with your text Ids:
trans-unit.target: In the response below, you get the list of scores associated with your text Ids:

trans-unit.source: In the POST call below, we are requesting for the list of sentiments for the key phrases in the following texts:
trans-unit.target: In the POST call below, we are requesting for the list of sentiments for the key phrases in the following texts:

trans-unit.source: It was a wonderful hotel to stay at, with unique decor and friendly staff
trans-unit.target: It was a wonderful hotel to stay at, with unique decor and friendly staff

trans-unit.source: It was an amazing build conference, with very interesting talks
trans-unit.target: It was an amazing build conference, with very interesting talks

trans-unit.source: The traffic was terrible, I spent three hours going to the airport
trans-unit.target: The traffic was terrible, I spent three hours going to the airport

trans-unit.source: In the response below, you get the list of key phrases associated with your text Ids:
trans-unit.target: In the response below, you get the list of key phrases associated with your text Ids:

trans-unit.source: The Ids entered into the system are the Ids returned by the system.
trans-unit.target: The Ids entered into the system are the Ids returned by the system.

trans-unit.source: The web service does not check that the Ids are unique.
trans-unit.target: The web service does not check that the Ids are unique.

trans-unit.source: It is the responsibility of the caller to verify uniqueness.
trans-unit.target: It is the responsibility of the caller to verify uniqueness.
